title: Regulations 1938 to 2024 and these Regulations shall be construed as one and
heading: 5. The fee to be paid under Section 15(2)(d) of the Act or Rule 24 in the
text_raw:
5. The fee to be paid under Section 15(2)(d) of the Act or Rule 24 in the 
Schedule of the Act by an applicant for a copy of the register of electors or part 
thereof shall be €100. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

31 March, 2025. 

JAMES BROWNE, 

Minister for Housing, Local Government and Heritage. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 4th April, 2025.

RULE 2

FORM OF CLAIM TO BE REGISTERED AS AN ELECTOR IN 
REGISTER OF ELECTORS OF THE HIGHER EDUCATION 
CONSTITUENCY (Referred to/provided for in Rules 2-8 and 14) 

 
 
 
 
 
 [104] 5 

It’s easier online! 

The easiest way to 
register to vote is online 
www.SeanadVoter.ie 

Information and Guidance 

Claim for entry to the register for the Higher Education Constituency 

This form should be used by eligible persons to submit their claim to be 
entered on the register of electors for the Seanad Higher Education 
constituency. The easiest way to register is by completing the application form 
online at www.SeanadVoter.ie. 

Important: Eligibility to Register 
You must be: 

Important Dates 
➢ Applications must be received by 

➢ a citizen of Ireland, and 
➢ eighteen years of age or 

the 26 February annually. 
➢ Late applications will not be 

older, and 

considered. 

➢ have received a degree (other 
than an honorary degree) 
which is at least at bachelor 
degree level, from a 
Designated Institution (list 
below). 

➢ The revised register of electors 
will be published and come into 
force on 1 June annually from

title: Regulations 1938 to 2024 and these Regulations shall be construed as one and
heading: The current (27th) Seanad includes the Senators elected on the basis of the
text_raw:
2026. 

The current (27th) Seanad includes the Senators elected on the basis of the 
NUI and University of Dublin (Trinity College) constituencies, with three 
Senators elected by each. Where vacancies occur among those elected in 
accordance with that process, NUI and University of Dublin (Trinity College) 
graduates who are included on the Higher Education constituency register will 
be eligible to vote in ensuing bye-elections if they opted-in to do so when making 
their application. This arrangement will apply only until any dissolution of the 
Dáil, from which point the Higher Education constituency will elect all six 
Senators. 

The first register of electors for the Higher Education constituency runs from 1 
April 2025 until 31 May 2026. A revised register will be published on 1 June 
2026 and every 1 June thereafter. If you are entered on the register in force you 
do not need to reapply to be included on the revised register. You must inform 
the Central Registration Authority of any changes to your address details or you 
may not receive your ballot. 

Information required 

The legal basis for this form, the information sought therein and how your 
information is used is set out in the Seanad Electoral (University Members) 
(Amendment) Act 2024. This includes provisions to seek some personal data 
including name, address, date of birth, Personal Public Service Number (PPSN) 
and confirmation that you are an Irish citizen. It also sets out the legal basis for 
sharing data with other designated institutions, the Minister for Social Protection 
(to cross-check your PPSN for identity purposes) and any Minister of the 
Government or specified public body (for example An tArd-Chláraitheoir – in 

 
 
 6 [104] 

connection with death events), where it is necessary and proportionate, including 
to verify the accuracy of a claim and to identify duplicates. 

Important 

If you were previously on the register for the NUI constituency or the University 
of Dublin (Trinity College) constituency you will not be automatically added to 
the register for the Higher Education constituency. You will need to register if 
you have not already done so. 

Completing this Form 

Sections A, B and C must be completed by all applicants 

Section A: Identity Details: All applicants are required to complete Section A 
identity details, including providing their PPSN. Providing your PPSN will 
enable confirmation of your identity details and help to protect the integrity of 
the register. 

Evidence of citizenship: Applicants are also asked to provide supporting 
documentation in relation to their citizenship. This may be a copy of the photo 
page of your valid Irish Passport or a copy of your Certificate of Naturalisation. 

Section B: Qualification Details: All applicants are required to complete the 
relevant parts of Section B. 

This information will be shared for verification with the relevant designated 
institution. In this section you are advised to include sufficient information to 
help your institution to verify your degree qualification(s). If you do not have 
all of the information requested, you are advised to include any other information 
that might assist your institution in confirming your record. 

Section C: Declaration of Truthfulness: All applicants are required 
complete the declaration of truthfulness. 

to 

Section D: Witness Form: Only required if the applicant does not provide their 
PPSN or if they are requested to so by the Chief Registration Officer. 

 
 
 
 [104] 7 

Designated Institutions 

To be eligible to apply, you must have received a degree from a designated institution. 
Designated institution means each of the following: 
the National University of Ireland, 
the University of Dublin (Trinity College), and 
institutions that are designated under the Higher Education Authority Act 2022 
(listed below). 

• 
• 
• 

The definition includes institutions that have been dissolved and had their functions 
transferred to a designated institution. For more information, visit www.SeanadVoter.ie. 
Atlantic Technological 
University 
Dublin City University (DCU) 
Dun Laoghaire Institute of Art, 
Design & Technology (IADT) 
Dundalk Institute of 
Technology (DkIT) 
Maynooth University 
Munster Technological 
University (MTU) 

National College of Art 
and Design (NCAD) 
Royal College of Surgeons 
in Ireland (RCSI) 
South East Technological 
University 
Technological University 
Dublin 

Technological University 
of the Shannon Midlands 
Midwest 
University of Dublin 
(Trinity College) 
University College Cork 
University College 
Dublin 
University of Galway 
University of Limerick 

The Higher Education Authority Act 2022 also provides that other institutions may be 
designated in the future. 

It’s easier online! 
The easiest way to register to vote is online www.SeanadVoter.ie 

You can submit this form by post to: 
SeanadVoter.ie 
PO Box 13784 
Dublin 2 
Ireland 

Before sending your paper form, please ensure 
you: 

➢ Complete sections A and B, 
➢ Sign and date the declaration (Section 

C), 

➢ Attach proof of citizenship, 
➢ Attach witness form (Section D, if 

required).

 [104] 9 

Section B: Qualification Details – All applicants must complete this section 

• 

If you have a degree from NUI or University of Dublin (Trinity College) 
or both, please complete Table 1 only. This is relevant if you want to 
be able to vote in bye-elections that may arise in the existing 
constituencies in the 27th Seanad. 

• All other applicants should complete Table 2. You only need to include 
one degree in Table 2 even if you have more than one. Each person will 
only have one vote in the new Higher Education constituency. 

• For more information, please go to Seanadvoter.ie

Additional details about your Degree(s) (Optional): 

Providing additional information relevant to your degree(s) may help your institution to 
match your records. Helpful information could include for example, the name of the 
institution you attended, the location of the campus where you studied, the name of the 
awarding body that awarded your degree, or any other relevant information. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10 [104] 

Section C: Declaration of Truthfulness - All applicants must complete this 
section 

I believe that the details I have provided on this form are true to the best of my 
knowledge and belief.* 
I understand that it is an offence under electoral law to knowingly give false or 
misleading information.* 
I understand it is my responsibility to inform the Chief Registration Officer of 
any changes to my name or address details. 

____________________________________ 
Signature of Applicant Date 

__________________ 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [104] 11 

Section D: Seanad Éireann Electoral Registration Witness Form 

If you have not provided a PPS Number in your application, take this form and 
your photographic identification (ID) to your local Garda station or any 
Notary/Notary Public to confirm your identity. If they are satisfied as to your 
identity, they will witness you signing this form, and then proceed to sign, date, 
and stamp the form. If you are unable to attend your local Garda station or a 
Notary/Notary Public due to illness or disability, you must have your form 
endorsed by a registered medical practitioner in the same manner. 

The Chief Registration Officer for the Higher Education constituency may also 
request you to complete this section and have it witnessed.

 14 [104] 

RULE 25 

Form SV04 

NOTICE OF APPEAL TO CHIEF REGISTRATION OFFICER OF A 
DECISION MADE 

 
 
 [104] 15 

It’s easier online! 

The easiest way to 
register to vote is online 
www.SeanadVoter.ie 

This form should be used by a person who wishes to appeal against a decision of the chief 
registration officer. The appeal must be made within five days of the decision of the chief 
registration officer. Notice of this appeal must also be given by the person making the 
appeal to any other party affected. 

The chief registration officer shall transmit this appeal to the county registrar in the manner 
directed by rules of court, together with a statement of the material facts, which in the 
opinion of the chief registration officer, have been established in the case, and of his or her 
decision upon the whole case and on any point which may be specified as a ground of 
appeal. 

To the Chief Registration Officer 

I, (Insert your name), of 

_______________, __________________, ________________ (Insert your address) 

 hereby give notice of appeal against your decision (Insert details of decision here) 

The grounds for my appeal are as follows (Insert the reason for the appeal here) 

Signature: Date: 

Print name 

Note: Where it appears to the chief registration officer that any two or more notices of 
appeal from his or her decisions are based on similar grounds, he or she shall inform the 
county registrar for the county of that fact for the purpose of enabling the judge hearing such 
appeals (if he or she so thinks fit) to consolidate such appeals or to select 
one of such appeals as a test case.

title: Regulations 1938 to 2024 and these Regulations shall be construed as one and
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These regulations prescribe three forms associated with the registration process 
for the Seanad Higher Education constituency: the claim form for entry on to the 
register of electors, the claim form for the correction of an entry on the register 
of electors; and the notice of appeal form to the chief registration officer in 
relation to a decision made by the chief registration officer. They also prescribe 
the fee to be charged for the provision of a copy of the register of electors or part 
thereof. 

Provision for the forms and fees is included in the Seanad Electoral (University 
Members) (Amendment) Act 2024.
